quoteFirst: _April_ 21. Called all hands at 5.30 A.M. and up anchor at 6. A.M. I called the old man at
quoteLast: Signaled over to pullout and we are tailing on behind untill we get out of the Straights, going about 10 knots; at 6 Bells met a steamer Bound for Klondyke, we drop a whale boat and sent our Boarding officer to find out the news if there was any But was disapointed.
title: The Voyage of the Oregon from San Francisco to Santiago in 1898
author: Cross, R., active 1898

quoteLast: Cairo opens with a stern gun,--shot strikes close under hull of Little Rebel. Our boats' bows up stream. Rebels advancing slowly. Bang--bang--bang--bang from each of the vessels.
title:
The Boys of '61
or, Four Years of Fighting, Personal Observations with the Army and Navy
author: Coffin, Charles Carleton, 1823-1896

quoteLast: |               | Parisian hears weak signals from MPA.
title: Loss of the Steamship "Titanic"
author: Great Britain. Court to investigate loss of steamship "Titanic"

quoteFirst: Edward the Second, and his beautiful but perfidious queen, Isabella of France, made Windsor Castle their frequent abode; and here, on the 13th day of November 1312 at
quoteLast: in the morning, was born a prince, over whose nativity the wizard Merlin must have presided. Baptized within the old chapel by the name of Edward, this prince became afterwards the third monarch of the name, and the greatest, and was also styled, from the place of his birth, EDWARD OF WINDSOR.
title: Windsor Castle
author: Ainsworth, William Harrison, 1805-1882

quoteLast: Cairo opens with a stern gun,--shot strikes close under hull of Little Rebel. Our boats' bows up stream. Rebels advancing slowly. Bang--bang--bang--bang from each of the vessels.
title:

title: The history of the Twentieth (Light) Division

quoteFirst: You start to write your message at
quoteLast: . You straighten out your former position and send strong connecting and reconnoitering patrols to north and west.

quoteFirst: "The silence of the Carpathia's engines, the piercing cold, the clamor of many voices in the companionways, caused me to dress hurriedly and awaken my wife, at
quoteLast: Monday. Our stewardess, meeting me outside, pointed to a wailing host in the rear dining room and said. 'From the Titanic. She's at the bottom of the ocean.
title: Sinking of the Titanic and Great Sea Disasters
author: Marshall, Logan, 1884-1937 [Editor]
